segments.en: Hello, everyone.
Welcome back to another great lesson here with us at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一堂精彩课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're going to be getting money.
That's right.
We're going to have a lesson about the ATM.
segments.cn: 我们将进行关于ATM的课程。

segments.en: The ATM or... Automatic Teller Machine.
Okay, that's what it stands for.
ATM.
So we're going to be looking at the language that you'll probably find in an ATM maybe in the United States or in an English-speaking country.
segments.cn: 所以我们将看看你可能在美国或英语国家的ATM中看到的语言。

segments.en: That's right.
But before we begin, why don't we look at some vocabulary that we'll hear in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 但在开始之前，我们先看看对话中会听到的一些词汇。

segments.en: Vocabulary Preview.
As we mentioned, the ATM or Automatic Teller Machine is a machine where you get your money, right?
segments.cn: 正如我们提到的，ATM或自动取款机是你取钱的机器，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
And also, well, some people are in different places.
segments.cn: 还有，一些地方的人可能称它为银行机器。

segments.en: They may call it the bank machine.
segments.cn: 是的，或者可能叫现金机器。

segments.en: Or just the money machine or something.
segments.cn: 或者就叫钱机器之类的。

segments.en: Alright.
So ATM.
ATM.
And now let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看下一个词。

segments.en: Local Authorities.
The Local Authorities.
The Local Authorities.
So what are the local authorities?
Well, basically it's the police.
The police.
Why do you say local authorities?
Okay, well, authority is the person in charge, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，权威是负责的人，对吧？

segments.en: The boss.
So the local authorities are basically the people who are the boss of this place.
segments.cn: 所以当地当局基本上是这个地方的负责人。

segments.en: In that area?
Yeah.
So the police.
The local authorities.
So why don't we start now with our dialogue.
segments.cn: 那我们现在开始对话吧。

segments.en: Why are we talking about local authorities and ATM machines?
segments.cn: 我们为什么要谈论当地当局和ATM机器？

segments.en: I don't know.
We gotta listen to find out.
Stupid girl making me spend so much money.
segments.cn: 笨女孩让我花了这么多钱。

segments.en: Now I have to get it from the ATM.
Hello, welcome to Universal Bank.
Please insert your card into the slot.
I know where to put my card.
Stupid machine talking to me like I'm an idiot.
segments.cn: 笨机器像我傻瓜一样跟我说话。

segments.en: Please input your six-digit PIN code followed by the pound key.
segments.cn: 请输入您的六位数PIN码，然后按井号键。

segments.en: Thank you.
Please select an option.
Thank you.
You have selected withdraw.
Yeah, yeah, I know what I selected.
segments.cn: 是的，是的，我知道我选择了什么。

segments.en: Just give me my money.
Please type the amount you would like to withdraw.
segments.cn: 请输入您想取款的金额。

segments.en: Thank you.
You want to transfer.
10,000 US dollars to the World Wildlife Foundation.
segments.cn: 10,000美元转给世界野生动物基金会。

segments.en: If this is correct, please press 1.
No, no.
Stupid machine, what are you doing?
No!
Confirmed.
Thank you for using our bank.
segments.cn: 感谢您使用我们的银行。

segments.en: Please remove your card from the slot.
segments.cn: 请从插槽中取出您的卡。

segments.en: Goodbye.
No way!
What happened?
Give me my money!
Danger!
Danger!
The exits have been sealed and the doors will remain locked until the local authorities arrive.
segments.cn: 出口已被封锁，门将保持锁定，直到当地当局到达。

segments.en: Thank you for using our bank.
segments.cn: 感谢您使用我们的银行。

segments.en: Have a nice day.
No!
All right, so it's not his day today.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天不是他的日子。

segments.en: I think he was very unlucky and maybe he's gonna be in trouble.
segments.cn: 我觉得他非常不幸，可能会有麻烦。

segments.en: I know, and he was on a date.
This is probably one of the worst things that can happen to a guy when he's on a date.
segments.cn: 这可能是一个人在约会时能遇到的最糟糕的事情之一。

segments.en: All right, yes, so, well, we saw some of the language that was related to an ATM money and banking, so why don't we take a look at that now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，是的，我们看到了与ATM、钱和银行相关的一些语言，所以我们现在来看看语言要点。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
All right, so the guy had to insert his card into the slot.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个家伙必须把他的卡插入插槽。

segments.en: Okay, so slot.
Slot.
All right, slot.
And that is an opening, right, or a type of hole maybe.
segments.cn: 这是一个开口，对吧，或者可能是一种孔。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a hole that is usually long.
segments.cn: 是的，它通常是一个长孔。

segments.en: Long and it's like a rectangular hole.
segments.cn: 长的，像一个长方形的孔。

segments.en: Yeah, a slot is never a circle.
segments.cn: 是的，插槽从来不是圆形的。

segments.en: Okay, so for example, when you get mail, the mailman will put it into your mailbox through the slot.
segments.cn: 好的，例如，当你收到邮件时，邮递员会通过插槽把邮件放入你的邮箱。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay, well, and now that he put his card into the slot, he had to input a six-digit PIN code.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在他把卡放入插槽后，他必须输入六位数的PIN码。

segments.en: Want to just do both together?
Digit and PIN code?
Yeah.
Okay, so a six-digit PIN code.
All right, now we have two words here that are new.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们有两个新词。

segments.en: Digit.
Digit is basically a number between zero and nine.
segments.cn: 数字基本上是零到九之间的一个数字。

segments.en: Okay, so any number between zero and nine is considered a digit.
segments.cn: 好的，所以零到九之间的任何数字都被视为数字。

segments.en: Yes, so 100 is made up of three digits.
segments.cn: 是的，所以100由三个数字组成。

segments.en: Three digits, okay.
And what about PIN code?
A PIN code is your secret number that you use to take money out.
segments.cn: PIN码是你用来取钱的秘密号码。

segments.en: Now why wouldn't we say password?
segments.cn: 现在为什么不说密码呢？

segments.en: Password is usually letters.
Okay, and PIN code is numbers.
Exactly.
All right, he had to input his six-digit PIN code, and then after that, he had to press the pound key.
segments.cn: 好吧，他必须输入他的六位数PIN码，然后按下井号键。

segments.en: Pound key.
Now this is strange.
A pound key.
What is that?
Well, you know on a phone, on the bottom right, there's a key or a button that looks like a number sign.
segments.cn: 嗯，你知道在电话上，右下角有一个看起来像数字符号的键或按钮。

segments.en: Number sign, so kind of like two vertical lines and two horizontal lines.
segments.cn: 数字符号，就像两条竖线和两条横线。

segments.en: Yeah, two lines going up and down, two lines going across.
segments.cn: 是的，两条竖线，两条横线。

segments.en: Okay, so that's called the pound key.
All right, what about the other one?
It's called the star.
The star key.
All right, so after the PIN code, after the pound key, now he's ready to withdraw money.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在输入PIN码和井号键后，他现在准备取钱。

segments.en: So we heard withdrawal.
Okay, so withdrawal is... Is a noun.
It's the action of taking money out.
Okay, a withdrawal.
A withdrawal.
Okay, and to withdraw.
To withdraw is just the verb.
To take out money.
Exactly.
So we have the noun and the verb.
segments.cn: 所以我们有名词和动词。

segments.en: The only difference is an L at the end.
Yes, so withdrawal noun and withdraw verb.
segments.cn: 是的，所以取款是名词，取出是动词。

segments.en: Okay, and well, he wanted to withdraw money, but something happened with the ATM and it turned out that he was going to transfer money.
segments.cn: 好的，他想取钱，但ATM出了点问题，结果他要转账。

segments.en: So transfer.
Transfer.
Transfer.
When you transfer money, you take it from one place and put it in another.
segments.cn: 当你转账时，你是把钱从一个地方放到另一个地方。

segments.en: Okay, and usually in banking, when you transfer money, you don't really see it, right?
segments.cn: 好的，通常在银行业务中，当你转账时，你并不真的看到它，对吗？

segments.en: Exactly.
It's all electronic, so you just put it from one bank account to another, but you never actually see this money.
segments.cn: 这都是电子的，所以你只是把钱从一个银行账户转到另一个，但你实际上从未看到这笔钱。

segments.en: Exactly.
So transfer money.
Transfer.
And now this one also has a verb and a noun, right?
segments.cn: 现在这个也有动词和名词，对吗？

segments.en: Right.
A transfer.
And to transfer.
Same word.
Yep.
Easy.
All right, so why don't we listen to our dialogue for the second time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们为什么不再听一次对话。

segments.en: It's going to be slowed down a little bit, and then we'll come back and look at some phrases.
segments.cn: 会稍微放慢一点，然后我们再回来看看一些短语。

segments.en: Stupid girl making me spend so much money.
segments.cn: 笨女孩让我花这么多钱。

segments.en: Now I have to get it from the ATM.
Hello, welcome to Universal Bank.
segments.cn: 你好，欢迎来到环球银行。

segments.en: Please insert your card into the slot.
I know where to put my card.
Stupid machine talking to me like I'm an idiot.
segments.cn: 笨机器跟我说话就像我是一名傻瓜。

segments.en: Please input your six digit PIN code followed by the pound key.
segments.cn: 请输入您的六位数PIN码，然后按井号键。

segments.en: Thank you.
Please have selected withdraw.
Yeah, yeah.
I know what I selected.
Just give me my money.
Please type the amount you would like to withdraw.
segments.cn: 请键入您想取款的金额。

segments.en: Thank you.
You want to transfer.
10,000 US dollars to the World Wildlife Foundation.
segments.cn: 10,000美元到世界野生动物基金会。

segments.en: If this is correct, please press one.
No, no.
Stupid machine, what are you doing?
No.
Confirmed.
Thank you for using our bank.
segments.cn: 感谢您使用我们的银行。

segments.en: Please remove your card from the slot.
segments.cn: 请从插槽中取出您的卡。

segments.en: Goodbye.
No way.
What happened?
Give me my money.
Danger.
Danger.
The exits have been sealed and the doors will remain locked until the local authorities arrive.
segments.cn: 出口已被封锁，门将保持锁定，直到当地当局到达。

segments.en: Thank you for using our bank.
segments.cn: 感谢您使用我们的银行。

segments.en: Have a nice day.
No.
Okay, so that was a little easier to understand.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这稍微容易理解一些。

segments.en: But Marco, there's some interesting phrases here, some instructions that you commonly read or hear when you're using a bank machine.
segments.cn: 但是Marco，这里有一些有趣的短语，一些你在使用银行机器时常常会读到或听到的指示。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at these phrases in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 所以我们为什么不看看这些短语在流利度构建器中。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
Well, the bank machine told this guy to insert your card.
segments.cn: 嗯，银行机器告诉这个人插入卡片。

segments.en: Insert your card.
Insert your card.
So this verb, to insert, to place inside.
segments.cn: 所以这个动词，插入，放入内部。

segments.en: Exactly.
So what else can we insert?
segments.cn: 那么我们还可以插入什么？

segments.en: Well, for example, commonly you insert a disc.
segments.cn: 嗯，例如，通常你插入一个光盘。

segments.en: Yeah, in your computer.
In your computer.
Yep.
Or maybe insert a CD into your CD player.
segments.cn: 或者把CD插入你的CD播放器。

segments.en: Or DVD into your DVD player.
segments.cn: 或者把DVD插入你的DVD播放器。

segments.en: Yep.
Alright, so to insert something, to put inside.
segments.cn: 好的，所以插入东西，就是放进去。

segments.en: Yes.
So he had to insert his card into the slot.
segments.cn: 所以他必须把卡插入插槽。

segments.en: And then the bank machine asked him to select an option.
segments.cn: 然后银行机器让他选择一个选项。

segments.en: Select an option.
Select an option.
Now this is a very common phrase that you will not only see in ATMs but basically everywhere, right?
segments.cn: 现在这是一个非常常见的短语，你不仅会在ATM看到，基本上到处都能见到，对吧？

segments.en: Like in computers or the Internet or many things where you're dealing with machines.
segments.cn: 比如在电脑、互联网或许多与机器打交道的地方。

segments.en: So it's an order that says, well, select one of these choices that you have.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个命令，意思是，选择你拥有的这些选项之一。

segments.en: Make a choice.
Make a choice.
Yeah.
Select an option.
Alright, so two simple phrases but very useful and also very high frequency, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以两个简单的短语，但非常有用且频率很高，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and you know what?
When you use phrases like these two, it sounds quite professional, doesn't it?
segments.cn: 当你使用像这两个短语时，听起来很专业，不是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, a little bit formal.
Okay, so why don't we listen to our dialogue for the last time and then we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 好的，那我们再听一次对话，然后再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Stupid girl making me spend so much money.
segments.cn: 笨女孩让我花这么多钱。

segments.en: Now I have to get it from the ATM.
Hello, welcome to Universal Bank.
segments.cn: 你好，欢迎来到环球银行。

segments.en: Please insert your card into the slot.
I know where to put my card.
Stupid machine talking to me like I'm an idiot.
segments.cn: 笨机器跟我说话，像我是一名傻瓜。

segments.en: Please input your six-digit pin code followed by the pound key.
segments.cn: 请输入您的六位数密码，然后按井号键。

segments.en: Thank you.
Please select an option.
Thank you.
You have selected withdraw.
Yeah, yeah, I know what I selected.
segments.cn: 是的，是的，我知道我选择了什么。

segments.en: Just give me my money.
Please type the amount you would like to withdraw.
segments.cn: 请输入您想取款的金额。

segments.en: Thank you.
You want to transfer 10,000 US dollars to the World Wildlife Foundation.
segments.cn: 您想将10,000美元转账给世界野生动物基金会。

segments.en: If this is correct, please press one.
No, no.
Stupid machine, what are you doing?
No.
Confirmed.
Thank you for using our bank.
segments.cn: 感谢您使用我们的银行。

segments.en: Please remove your card from the slot.
segments.cn: 请从插槽中取出您的卡。

segments.en: Goodbye.
No way!
What happened?
Give me my money!
Danger, danger!
The exits have been sealed and the doors will remain locked until the local authorities arrive.
segments.cn: 出口已被封闭，门将保持锁定，直到当地当局到达。

segments.en: Thank you for using our bank.
segments.cn: 感谢您使用我们的银行。

segments.en: Have a nice day.
Nooooooo!
All right, Erika, so what about you?
Have you ever had any problems with the ATM?
segments.cn: 你有没有在ATM遇到过问题？

segments.en: I've had more problems than I can count.
segments.cn: 我遇到过的问题比我能数的还多。

segments.en: What happened?
Well, I think in the last two years I've probably lost about seven bank cards in an ATM.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想在过去两年里，我可能在ATM丢失了大约七张银行卡。

segments.en: Really?
You forget it in the slot?
segments.cn: 你把它忘在插槽里了吗？

segments.en: I leave it in the slot and then walk away from the bank machine and no bank cards.
segments.cn: 我把它留在插槽里，然后走开，结果没有银行卡。

segments.en: Well, I think now the ATMs, because this is a common problem, now they have like a little alarm that when you take out your money and everything it just starts beeping and beeping until you take out your card.
segments.cn: 嗯，我觉得现在的ATM，因为这是一个常见问题，现在它们有一个小警报，当你取出钱和其他东西时，它会一直响，直到你取出你的卡。

segments.en: Yes, and I like the bank machines that actually give you your card first and then give you your money.
segments.cn: 是的，我喜欢那些实际上先给你卡，然后再给你钱的银行机器。

segments.en: Because if they give me my money first that's all I want, right?
segments.cn: 因为如果他们先给我钱，那就是我想要的，对吧？

segments.en: So I run away with my money and leave my card in the bank machine.
segments.cn: 所以我拿着钱跑了，留下我的卡在银行机器里。

segments.en: Right, I think that's a good idea.
segments.cn: 对，我觉得这是个好主意。

segments.en: I've never seen it before though.
In Switzerland they have them like that.
segments.cn: 在瑞士他们就有这样的机器。

segments.en: Or what about the ATMs that you only have to swipe your card?
segments.cn: 或者那些只需刷卡的ATM呢？

segments.en: Oh yeah, I've done that as well and also ruined a bank card with that.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，我也做过，并且还把银行卡弄坏了。

segments.en: I swiped it too many times, put in the wrong pin code, and it blocked your card.
segments.cn: 我刷了太多次，输入了错误的密码，结果卡被锁了。

segments.en: Yeah, terrible.
Well, what about you guys?
I'm sure everyone has some experience or some inconvenience with ATM machines.
segments.cn: 我相信每个人都有一些与ATM机器的经历或不便。

segments.en: So why don't you come to our website and tell us all about it?
segments.cn: 所以你们为什么不来我们的网站告诉我们所有的事情呢？

segments.en: You can also find lots more resources on our website to help you learn English.
segments.cn: 你还可以在我们的网站上找到更多资源，帮助你学习英语。

segments.en: So check it out and until next time, goodbye!
segments.cn: 所以请查看，直到下次，再见！
